author: Cortex XSOAR

automation.description: This script grants a user the permissions needed to create a Teams meeting. It connects to MS Teams, creating an application access policy to a chosen application and then grants a user permissions.
automation.name: ConfigureAzureApplicationAccessPolicy

automation.description: Send a team member or channel a question with predefined response options on Microsoft Teams. The response can be used to close a task (might be conditional) in a playbook.
automation.name: MicrosoftTeamsAsk

commands.description:
Sends a message to the specified teams.
To mention a user in the message, add a semicolon ";" at the end of the user mention. For example: @Bruce Willis;
commands.name: send-notification

commands.description: Mirrors the XSOAR investigation to the specified Microsoft Teams channel.
commands.name: mirror-investigation

commands.description: Deletes the specified Microsoft Teams channel.
commands.name: close-channel

commands.description: Returns real-time and historical data on the integration status.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-integration-health

commands.description: Creates a new channel in a Microsoft Teams team.
commands.name: create-channel

commands.description: Adds a member (user) to a private channel.
commands.name: add-user-to-channel

commands.description: Ring a user's Teams account. Note: This is a ring only! no media will play in case the generated call is answered. To use this make sure your Bot has the following permissions - Calls.Initiate.All and Calls.InitiateGroupCall.All
commands.name: microsoft-teams-ring-user

commands.description: Adds a member (user) to a private channel.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-add-user-to-channel

commands.description: Creates a new channel in a Microsoft Teams team.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-create-channel

commands.description: Creates a new meeting in Microsoft Teams.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-create-meeting

integration.description: Send messages and notifications to your team members.
integration.name: Microsoft Teams

commands.description: Send a message to Microsoft Teams via Incoming Webhook
commands.name: ms-teams-message

integration.description: Integration for sending notifications to a Microsoft Teams channel via Incoming Webhook.
integration.name: Microsoft Teams via Webhook

commands.description: Run this command to start the authorization process and follow the instructions in the command results.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-auth-start

commands.description:
Run this command to complete the authorization process.
Should be used after running the microsoft-teams-auth-start command.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-auth-complete

commands.description: Run this command if for some reason you need to rerun the authentication process.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-auth-reset

commands.description: Tests connectivity to Microsoft.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-auth-test

commands.description: Creates a new team.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-team-create

commands.description: Create a new team under a group. In order to create a team, the group must have a least one owner and the group cannot be of type Security.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-team-create-from-group

commands.description: Returns all the groups that have teams in an organization.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-teams-list

commands.description: Update the properties of the specified team.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-team-update

commands.description: Deletes a group. Note: it might take time for the team to disappear from the teams list.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-team-delete

commands.description: Retrieve the properties and relationships of the specified team.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-team-get

commands.description: Returns the members of the specified team.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-members-list

commands.description: Gets a member of a team.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-member-get

commands.description: Add a user to be a team member.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-member-add

commands.description: Remove a member from the team.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-member-remove

commands.description: Updates a team member.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-member-update

commands.description: Archive the specified team. When a team is archived, users can no longer send or like messages on any channel in the team, edit the team's name, description, or other settings, or in general make most changes to the team. Membership changes to the team continue to be allowed. Archiving is an async operation. A team is archived once the async operation completes successfully, which may occur subsequent to a response from this command. In order to archive a team, the team and group must have an owner.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-team-archive

commands.description: Restore an archived team. This restores the users' ability to send messages and edit the team, abiding by tenant and team settings. Unarchiving is an async operation. A team is unarchived once the async operation completes successfully, which may occur subsequent to a response from this command.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-team-unarchive

commands.description: Create a copy of a team. This operation also creates a copy of the corresponding group. Cloning is a long-running operation.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-team-clone

commands.description: Get the teams in Microsoft Teams that the user is a direct member of.
commands.name: microsoft-teams-teams-list-joined

integration.description: Manage teams and members in Microsoft Teams.
integration.name: Microsoft Teams Management

description: Send messages and notifications to your team members.
name: Microsoft Teams
